programme.title: V.I.P. - Veiksme. Intuīcija. Prāts
programme.desc: Šī spēle ir mūsu kopīgais ieguldījums labdarības maratonā "Dod pieci!", lai palīdzētu bērniem ar kustību traucējumiem — tiem, kam ikdienas soļi prasa īpašu spēku. Kapteiņi: Toms Grēviņš un Kārlis Kazāks. Toms Grēviņš - komandas kapteinis, labdarības maratonā "Dod pieci!" iesaistīts kopš tā pirmās reizes Latvijā 2014. gadā. Toms ir arī Latvijas Radio 5 "tētis" kopš 2013. gada, kad pirmo reizi ieskandinājis Latvijas Radio 5 - Pieci.lv. Viņš ir neatņemama sastāvdaļa radio, televīzijas un Latvijas šovu industrijas rīkotajos projektos un pasākumos. Toms ir dīdžejs un mūzikas žurnālists. Latvijas Radio 5 vada raidījumu "Vēl viens starts". Kopš 2023. gada sākuma vada pēcpusdienas raidījumu "Starpbrīdis". Agnese Ducena-Saidāne - fizioterapeite, mācījusies Rīgas 6. vidusskolā un vēlāk Rīgas Stradiņa universitātē. Brīvajā laikā dejo tautas dejas kolektīvā "Ūsiņš" un dzied Ķekavas jauktajā korī "Mozaīka". Ļoti labprāt dodas tuvākos un tālākos ceļojumos kopā ar ģimeni, kurā aug divi dēli. Patīk aktīvi pavadīt laiku - daudzus gadus ir spēlējusi florbolu, joprojām vasarās spēlē volejbolu, apmeklē zumbas nodarbības. Kā ikgadēja ģimenes tradīcija ir arī "Dod pieci!" maratona atbalstīšana. Raimonds Rudzāts - Latvijas Televīzijas sporta žurnālists. Saņēmis Latvijas Žurnālistu asociācijas speciālbalvu par izcilību sporta žurnālistikā, atzīts par Latvijas Televīzijas gada redaktoru-tvērēju 2022. gadā. Kopā ar domubiedriem 2020. gadā dibinājis "R. R. Fondu", kas nodrošina iespēju ikdienā apmeklēt ārpusskolas nodarbības bērniem ar ne tiem vieglākajiem sadzīves apstākļiem. Izveidota mentoru programma, kurā pieaugušie brīvprātīgi sniedz atbalstu ikdienas gaitās jauniešiem ar grūtībām skolā. Raimonds pats ir labdarības projekta iniciators un allaž atbalsta citus projektus. Kārlis Kazāks - komandas kapteinis, mūziķis, Latvijas Radio 5 - Pieci.lv direktors. Kārlis ar azartiskiem kolēģiem liek kopā jaunākās mūzikas un daudzpusīgas informācijas puzles gabaliņus Latvijas Radio 5 saturā un uztur sarunas pavedienu ar mūsu valsts cilvēkiem Latvijas Radio 1 raidījumā "Monopols". Debija mūzikā notika 1996. gadā grupas "Dull Doll" sastāvā, 2000. gadā Kazāks dibināja grupu "Oceanfall". 2008. gadā izdeva savu pirmo solo albumu "Uz manām plaukstām", šobrīd izdoti jau vairāki solo albumi. Kā mūziķis darbojies arī fondā "Viegli". Baiba Narvila - profesionālais ceļš 15 gadus ir veltīts fizioterapijai, cilvēku veselības stiprināšanai un izglītošanai. Uzņēmēja un augstskolas lektore, kurai svarīgi dalīties zināšanās un iedvesmot citus. Labdarībā iesaistās ne tikai ar ziedojumiem - ilgtermiņā aktīvi darbojas kā brīvprātīgā "Mentor Latvia" programmā, kas paredzēta jauniešiem no sociālā riska grupām, sniedzot emocionālu atbalstu, drošu pieaugušā klātbūtni un iedrošinājumu veidot veselīgus ieradumus. Patīk pārbaudīt savas iespēju robežas - gan ledainās peldēs, gan ejot pāri kvēlojošām oglēm. Matīss Vecvagaris - pedagogs, portāla LSM.lv tautas sporta sadaļas autors, labdarības 107 km garā skrējiensoļojuma organizators distancē Rīga-Valmiera. 10 gadu laikā skrējēju saime bērniem ar kustību traucējumiem saziedojuši vairāk nekā 60 000 eiro. Motivācija arvien turpināt rīkot šo skrējienu ir vecāku atsūtītie video, kur redzams bērnu progress pēc fizioterapijas nodarbībām rehabilitācijas centrā. Paša pieveikto ultramaratonu skaits pārsniedz pussimtu. Šoruden PČ diennakts skrējienā Francijā pieveicis 249 kilometrus, ieņemot 28. vietu.

programme.title: 1000 jūdzes Transilvānijā
programme.desc: Sudraba lodes, krusti pret vampīriem un saules baterija uz jumta. Tā bruņojušies, trīs vīri nē, nevis laivā, bet gan auto, devās piedzīvojumu ekspedīcijā 1000 jūdzes pa Transilvāniju.

programme.title: Province
programme.desc: Jau trešo gadu desmitu Aglonas bazilikas Kora skola pulcē jaunos talantus. Tur var mācīties dziedāt, spēlēt kokli, flautu, ērģeles. Mazajiem ērģelniekiem tiek uzticēts pavadīt Sv. Misi bazilikā, pat ja sīkie pirkstiņi nevar izstiepties oktāvas garumā un kājas vēl nesniedzas līdz apakšējiem ērģeļu pedāļiem. Bet visādi citādi Aglonas bazilikas Kora skola ir vieta, kur bijušie audzēkņi atgriežas jau pedagogu statusā, jo viņos ieaudzināta atbildība par savu vietu, savu baziliku, savu skolu, savu Latgali.

programme.title: Gudrs, vēl gudrāks
programme.desc: Šodien spēles "Gudrs, vēl gudrāks" skatītājiem un dalībniekiem trīskārši svētki - tuvojas Ziemassvētki, sākas skolēnu brīvlaiks un ir 8. klašu fināls. Lūk, mūsu olimpiskais sešinieks: Elizabete Kļava no Iecavas vidusskolas, Eva Auziņa no Rīgas Franču liceja, Dans Burkovskis no Rīgas Valsts 1. ģimnāzijas, Kārlis Zālītis no NMV Rīgas Doma kora skolas, Anrijs Savčenko no Zentas Mauriņas Grobiņas vidusskolas un Zane Gaidamaviča no Rīgas Centra humanitārās vidusskolas. Muzikāls sveiciens - dziesma "Piedzimšana" no grupas "Framest". Priecīgus Ziemassvētkus un laimīgu Jauno gadu!

programme.title: Kultūrdeva
programme.desc: "Kultūrdevas" pirmajā daļā viesosies pazīstamā tekstilmāksliniece Dzintra Vilks, kuras radošajam rokrakstam raksturīgi daudzveidīgi materiāli - vilna, lins, sizals, kokvilna, zīds… Iedvesmojoties no meža, pļavas, vēja, kukaiņiem, putniem, gadalaikiem un zāles stiebriem, viņa rada gobelēnus un telpiskus darbus, izstāstot tos tekstilmākslas valodā. Sarunās un mūzikā satiksimies ar Jāni Ķirsi un Beāti Zviedri.

programme.title: Neprāta cena
programme.desc: Neprāta cena ir Latvijas Televīzijas seriāls, kas tika rādīts kanālā LTV 1 no 2006. līdz 2009. gadam. Seriāls tika pārraidīts 4 reizes nedēļā. Piektdienās tika rādīts aizkadru seriāls "Neprāta spogulī".

programme.title: Ansī – slēpošanas kūrorts "Le Grand-Bornand". "Le Grand-Bornand"– 12,5 km masu starts sievietēm
programme.desc: Sievietēm Latviju pirmajos trijos posmos paredzēts pārstāvēt Baibai Bendikai, Esterei Volfai un Elzai Bleidelei. Vislielākā pieredze ir Bendikai, taču pērn arī viņai ne reizi neizdevās kvalificēties masu startam. Parasti dažām dalībniecēm izdodas nekļūdīgi šaut, un tas noteikti garantē augstu vietu, te tomēr kopā jāaizver 20 mērķi. Labām slēpotājām gan nav problēmu būt uz goda pjedestāla arī ar vienu vai diviem soda apļiem. Pirms gada Ansī negaidīti triumfēja jaunā vācu sportiste Selīna Grotiana, kas turklāt arī slēpošanā bija ātrāka par savu komandas biedreni Francisku Preisu. Pretēji prognozēm ļoti neveiksmīgs starts padevās Francijai, taču tagad Lū Žanmono ir viena no galvenajām favorītēm cīņā par pasaules kausu šosezon. Ansī šautuve ir pavisam neparasta, tā pat ikdienā (vasarā) nepastāv, to speciāli iekārto tieši sacīkstēm.

programme.title: Sporta studija
programme.desc: "Mūsu uzņemtais virziens izsakāms neformālā sauklī "sports sabiedrībai!". Šis virziens tika uzsākts jau iepriekš ar "Tautas sporta" sižetu sērijām un sporta laukumu kampaņām. Turpmāk LTV Tautas sporta sižeti būs tradicionāla "Sporta studijas" sastāvdaļa. "Sporta Studiju" vadīs rūdītie sporta žurnālisti Dāvids Ernštreits un Reinis Ošenieks, kā arī jaunās sporta žurnālistikas zvaigznes Andris Auziņš, Matīss Timofejevs un Raimonds Gekišs. "Sporta studijas" aktualitātēm sekojiet https://www.facebook.com/LTVSportaStudija

programme.title: Šerifs
programme.desc: Pavisam negaidīts ir fakts, ka bojā iet kāds skarbs radio dīdžejs. Vai nākamais upuris būs viņa labākais draugs? Un kā slepkavība ir saistīta ar sociālajiem tīkliem?

programme.title: Ansī – slēpošanas kūrorts "Le Grand-Bornand". "Le Grand-Bornand" – 15 km masu starts vīriešiem
programme.desc: Pēdējais starts biatlonā pirms Ziemassvētku pārtraukuma, ja neskaita komercsacīkstes pašiem labākajiem vēl Gelzenkirhenē "Schalke" futbola stadionā īsi pirms gadu mijas. Pirmais Pasaules kausa sacensību trimestris būs beidzies, vēl pēc Jaunā gada būs trīs posmi un tad - ziemas olimpiskās spēles Antholcas trasē. Jācer, ka Latvija būs pārstāvēta masu startā, te var piedalīties tikai labākie 30 (25 pēc kopējā reitinga un pieci pēc sasnieguma tieši Ansī posmā). Individuālajās sacīkstēs pirmajiem trim posmiem Latvija bez Rastorgujeva bija nominējusi arī Renāru Birkentālu un Aleksandru Patrijuku, kuriem gan būs ļoti grūti kvalificēties masu startam, konkurence biatlonā ir ļoti liela. Galvenajiem favorītiem allaž var pieskaitīt Francijas un Norvēģijas biatlonistus, arī labākos Zviedrijas, Vācijas un Itālijas sportistus, tāpat nedrīkst aizmirst par Šveices, ASV un Austrijas līderiem, vismaz amerikānis Kempbels Raits sezonas sākumā ir lieliskā formā.

programme.title: Šerifs
programme.desc: No diviem sitieniem pa galvu atrasts miris Žiljēns Lamārs, 31 gadu vecs radio diktors – kopā ar kolēģi viņš katru vakaru vadījis pārraidi "Žiljēna un Sedrika Kešs" kanālā "Radio sensācija". Izrādās, ka jau divas nedēļas abiem raidījuma vadītājiem pienākuši draudīgi zvani ar prasību raidījumu slēgt… Vai slepkava ir zvanītājs, un vai Sedriks ir nākamais upuris?

programme.title: Šerifs
programme.desc: Likā Ervjē, 32 gadus vecs ugunsdzēsējs, atrasts miris netālu no viņa auto. Blakus zāļu kastīte ar zīmīti "piedodiet" liecina par pašnāvību, taču drīz vien noskaidrojas, ka puisis noindēts. Ugunsdzēsēju depo komandieris Garnjē nevēlas, lai tiktu izjautāti viņa padotie, un pieprasa, lai viņam tiek ziņots par izmeklēšanas gaitu. Līdz ar to neviens īsti negrib par notikušo runāt, bet izmeklētājiem rodas aizdomas, ka slepkava ir kāds no savējiem.

programme.title: Šerifs
programme.desc: Pilsētas juristiem uzbrūk noziedznieks, draudot visus nogalināt. Šerifam nav daudz laika, lai atrastu vainīgo. Un ja nu uzbruks Deborai? Darba un privātā dzīve sāk neplānoti krustoties.

programme.title: Šerifs
programme.desc: Kapteinis Kaders Šerifs ļoti mīl savu darbu policijā. Viņš dzīvo tieši pretī policijas iecirknim. Gadiem zināms kā radikālu izmeklēšanas metožu piekritējs, Kaders sastopas ar jauno kapteini, Kadera partneri Adelīnu Briāru. Abi pretpoli, kuri tik ļoti darbā pievelkas, izrādās visai dinamisks policistu pāris! Alžīriešu izcelsmes franču aktieris Abdelhafids Metalsi televīzijā strādā kopš 2000. gadu sākuma, un šarmantais kapteinis Kaders ir viņa līdz šim spilgtākā loma.

programme.title: Aizliegtais paņēmiens
programme.desc: Lai uzzinātu par kāda notikuma patiesajiem apstākļiem vai iesaistīto personu nodomiem, raidījuma "Aizliegtais paņēmiens" komanda informācijas iegūšanai izmanto visdažādākos izmeklējošās žurnālistikas paņēmienus un žanrus – eksperimentus, testus, provokācijas, padziļinātus pētījumus, arī anonīmas intervijas. Žurnālisti padziļināti pēta un skatītājiem atklāj sociālpolitiskus tematus, kas ne vienmēr tiek izcelti citos medijos. Raidījums atklāj un atmasko, atsevišķos gadījumos sauc pie atbildības iesaistītās personas, norāda uz likumu nepilnībām, aicina mainīt pastāvošo kārtību, ja tā ir pretrunā sabiedrības interesēm. Raidījumu vada LTV Ziņu dienesta žurnālists Guntis Bojārs.

programme.title: Māra
programme.desc: Dokumentālās filmas "Māra" centrā ir režisore Māra Ķimele un viņas ceļš. Ceļa mērošanas laikā filmas autore Krista Burāne aplūko priekšstatus par cilvēka un mākslas attiecībām, teātri, sievietes režisores darbu un izvēlēm, kuras tas prasa. Filmas dokumentālā esence ir krustojums starp diviem ceļiem. Tajā ir daudz vēsturisku faktu un atsauču, fotogrāfiju un vēstuļu. Izmantoti arī neparasti inscenējuma elementi sarunu epizodēs, kur Māras dēla Pētera Ķimeļa austiņās runāto tekstu atkārto aktieris Toms Auniņš. Ļaušanās absolūtam teātrim, sevis pašas tēlošana Māru raksturo daudz precīzāk par jebkuru interviju. Filma ir par teātri un patiesību tajā. Trauslu, traku un mīlestības pilnu.

programme.title: Ziemas karalis
programme.desc: Arturs atgriežas zemē, no kuras padzīts, un atklāj, ka tajā valda haoss. Meklējot atbalstu pie senajiem biedriem, viņš sastopas ar negaidītiem šķēršļiem. Reinss un Ouveins dodas pie karaļa Kedvisa iekasēt nodevas. Arturs un viņa sabiedrotie gaida pārrodamies Gundleju un Gorfidu, bet Nimve nespēj Arturam piedod Gundleja atbrīvošanu.

programme.title: Globalizācija
programme.desc: Deutsche Welle žurnāls.

programme.title: Ražots Vācijā
programme.desc: Deutsche Welle žurnāls.

programme.title: Īlona Maska "Twitter" revolūcija
programme.desc: Dokumentālā filma "Īlona Maska "Twitter" revolūcija" pievēršas Maska ilgajām un bieži vien problemātiskajām attiecībām ar "Twitter". Režisors Džeimss Džakobijs pēta Īlona Maska pieaugošo ietekmi un iztaujā kompānijas pārstāvjus un industrijas ekspertus. Filma vēsta par "Twitter" pārpirkšanu, vārda brīvības problēmām un kompānijas neskaidro nākotni. Dokumentālās filmas "Īlona Maska "Twitter" revolūcija" pirmā daļa vēsta par to, kā Masks no aizrautīga platformas lietotāja kļuva par tās vienīgo īpašnieku. Režisors Džeimss Džakobijs sarunājas ar daudziem cilvēkiem, tostarp ar žurnālisti Karu Svišeri, biogrāfu Volteru Aizaksonu un daudziem bijušajiem "Twitter" darbiniekiem. Filma runā par absolūtu vārda brīvību, par nepatiesas informācijas izplatīšanu platformā un par "Twitter" kā ziņu avota lomu ārkārtas situāciju un krīžu laikā.

programme.title: Zinātnes noslēpumi
programme.desc: Dažādas mūsu ikdienā ierastas darbības un notikumi, izskaidroti no zinātnes viedokļa.

programme.title: Klausītājs
programme.desc: Valsts robeža ir nepārtraukta un noslēgta līnija, caur kuru iet sakrītoša vertikāla virsma. Neredzamā siena nosaka valsts teritoriju un norobežo to no kaimiņvalstīm. Šī ir neparasta vide, kurā iebraukt drīkst tikai ar speciālām atļaujām. Braucam vērot pierobežas joslu un ļaudis tajā.

programme.title: V.I.P. - Veiksme. Intuīcija. Prāts
programme.desc: Šī spēle ir mūsu kopīgais ieguldījums labdarības maratonā "Dod pieci!", lai palīdzētu bērniem ar kustību traucējumiem — tiem, kam ikdienas soļi prasa īpašu spēku. Kapteiņi: Toms Grēviņš un Kārlis Kazāks. Toms Grēviņš - komandas kapteinis, labdarības maratonā "Dod pieci!" iesaistīts kopš tā pirmās reizes Latvijā 2014. gadā. Toms ir arī Latvijas Radio 5 "tētis" kopš 2013. gada, kad pirmo reizi ieskandinājis Latvijas Radio 5 - Pieci.lv. Viņš ir neatņemama sastāvdaļa radio, televīzijas un Latvijas šovu industrijas rīkotajos projektos un pasākumos. Toms ir dīdžejs un mūzikas žurnālists. Latvijas Radio 5 vada raidījumu "Vēl viens starts". Kopš 2023. gada sākuma vada pēcpusdienas raidījumu "Starpbrīdis". Agnese Ducena-Saidāne - fizioterapeite, mācījusies Rīgas 6. vidusskolā un vēlāk Rīgas Stradiņa universitātē. Brīvajā laikā dejo tautas dejas kolektīvā "Ūsiņš" un dzied Ķekavas jauktajā korī "Mozaīka". Ļoti labprāt dodas tuvākos un tālākos ceļojumos kopā ar ģimeni, kurā aug divi dēli. Patīk aktīvi pavadīt laiku - daudzus gadus ir spēlējusi florbolu, joprojām vasarās spēlē volejbolu, apmeklē zumbas nodarbības. Kā ikgadēja ģimenes tradīcija ir arī "Dod pieci!" maratona atbalstīšana. Raimonds Rudzāts - Latvijas Televīzijas sporta žurnālists. Saņēmis Latvijas Žurnālistu asociācijas speciālbalvu par izcilību sporta žurnālistikā, atzīts par Latvijas Televīzijas gada redaktoru-tvērēju 2022. gadā. Kopā ar domubiedriem 2020. gadā dibinājis "R. R. Fondu", kas nodrošina iespēju ikdienā apmeklēt ārpusskolas nodarbības bērniem ar ne tiem vieglākajiem sadzīves apstākļiem. Izveidota mentoru programma, kurā pieaugušie brīvprātīgi sniedz atbalstu ikdienas gaitās jauniešiem ar grūtībām skolā. Raimonds pats ir labdarības projekta iniciators un allaž atbalsta citus projektus. Kārlis Kazāks - komandas kapteinis, mūziķis, Latvijas Radio 5 - Pieci.lv direktors. Kārlis ar azartiskiem kolēģiem liek kopā jaunākās mūzikas un daudzpusīgas informācijas puzles gabaliņus Latvijas Radio 5 saturā un uztur sarunas pavedienu ar mūsu valsts cilvēkiem Latvijas Radio 1 raidījumā "Monopols". Debija mūzikā notika 1996. gadā grupas "Dull Doll" sastāvā, 2000. gadā Kazāks dibināja grupu "Oceanfall". 2008. gadā izdeva savu pirmo solo albumu "Uz manām plaukstām", šobrīd izdoti jau vairāki solo albumi. Kā mūziķis darbojies arī fondā "Viegli". Baiba Narvila - profesionālais ceļš 15 gadus ir veltīts fizioterapijai, cilvēku veselības stiprināšanai un izglītošanai. Uzņēmēja un augstskolas lektore, kurai svarīgi dalīties zināšanās un iedvesmot citus. Labdarībā iesaistās ne tikai ar ziedojumiem - ilgtermiņā aktīvi darbojas kā brīvprātīgā "Mentor Latvia" programmā, kas paredzēta jauniešiem no sociālā riska grupām, sniedzot emocionālu atbalstu, drošu pieaugušā klātbūtni un iedrošinājumu veidot veselīgus ieradumus. Patīk pārbaudīt savas iespēju robežas - gan ledainās peldēs, gan ejot pāri kvēlojošām oglēm. Matīss Vecvagaris - pedagogs, portāla LSM.lv tautas sporta sadaļas autors, labdarības 107 km garā skrējiensoļojuma organizators distancē Rīga-Valmiera. 10 gadu laikā skrējēju saime bērniem ar kustību traucējumiem saziedojuši vairāk nekā 60 000 eiro. Motivācija arvien turpināt rīkot šo skrējienu ir vecāku atsūtītie video, kur redzams bērnu progress pēc fizioterapijas nodarbībām rehabilitācijas centrā. Paša pieveikto ultramaratonu skaits pārsniedz pussimtu. Šoruden PČ diennakts skrējienā Francijā pieveicis 249 kilometrus, ieņemot 28. vietu.

programme.title: Latvijas Sirdsdziesma
programme.desc: Arī šajā raidījuma sezonā klausīsimies jaunas un skanīgas aptaujas dziesmas un dzīvosim līdzi jaunrades tapšanas stāstiem! Arī šajā gadā dosimies Latvijas ārēs satikt interesantus un muzikālus cilvēkus, kuri ir mums tepat, blakus!

programme.title: Aizliegtais paņēmiens
programme.desc: Lai uzzinātu par kāda notikuma patiesajiem apstākļiem vai iesaistīto personu nodomiem, raidījuma "Aizliegtais paņēmiens" komanda informācijas iegūšanai izmanto visdažādākos izmeklējošās žurnālistikas paņēmienus un žanrus – eksperimentus, testus, provokācijas, padziļinātus pētījumus, arī anonīmas intervijas. Žurnālisti padziļināti pēta un skatītājiem atklāj sociālpolitiskus tematus, kas ne vienmēr tiek izcelti citos medijos. Raidījums atklāj un atmasko, atsevišķos gadījumos sauc pie atbildības iesaistītās personas, norāda uz likumu nepilnībām, aicina mainīt pastāvošo kārtību, ja tā ir pretrunā sabiedrības interesēm. Raidījumu vada LTV Ziņu dienesta žurnālists Guntis Bojārs.

programme.title: Sporta studija

Turpmāk LTV Tautas sporta sižeti būs tradicionāla "Sporta studijas" sastāvdaļa. "Sporta Studiju" vadīs rūdītie sporta žurnālisti Dāvids Ernštreits un Reinis Ošenieks, kā arī jaunās sporta žurnālistikas zvaigznes Andris Auziņš, Matīss Timofejevs un Raimonds Gekišs. "Sporta studijas" aktualitātēm sekojiet https://www.facebook.com/LTVSportaStudija

programme.title: Province
programme.desc: Jau trešo gadu desmitu Aglonas bazilikas Kora skola pulcē jaunos talantus. Tur var mācīties dziedāt, spēlēt kokli, flautu, ērģeles. Mazajiem ērģelniekiem tiek uzticēts pavadīt Sv. Misi bazilikā, pat ja sīkie pirkstiņi nevar izstiepties oktāvas garumā un kājas vēl nesniedzas līdz apakšējiem ērģeļu pedāļiem. Bet visādi citādi Aglonas bazilikas Kora skola ir vieta, kur bijušie audzēkņi atgriežas jau pedagogu statusā, jo viņos ieaudzināta atbildība par savu vietu, savu baziliku, savu skolu, savu Latgali.

programme.title: Vienmēr formā!
programme.desc: Deutsche Welle žurnāls

programme.title: Rīta Panorāma
programme.desc: Enerģisks un iedvesmojošs sākums jaunai dienai! Ieskats gaidāmās dienas notikumos Latvijā un pasaulē, kultūras, izklaides un sporta ziņas, laika prognoze. Arī atskats uz aizvadītās dienas notikumiem, pievēršot uzmanību to attīstībai nakts laikā. Aizrautīgas sarunas ar viesiem un skanīgi muzikālie priekšnesumi. Raidījumu vada Gusts Kikusts, Sigurds Siliņš, Karīna Rubene, Danuta Juste, sporta ziņas lasa Reinis Ošenieks, Raimonds Gekišs, laika ziņas – Ilze Skudra, Ilze Golubeva, Toms Bricis.

programme.title: Pasaules panorāma
programme.desc: Globālo ziņu laikmetā notikums Āzijā vai Amerikas kontinentā jau rīt var mainīt dzīvi Eiropā, bet lēmums, kas pieņemts Rīgā – atbalsoties visā pasaulē. "Pasaules panorāma" piedāvā neatkarīgas un uzticamas ziņas, atspoguļojot un analizējot ārpolitikas aktualitātes, kā arī sarunas ar politologiem, ārpolitikas ekspertiem, pasaulē pazīstamām personībām par svarīgāko Baltijā un Ziemeļvalstīs, citviet Eiropā, kā arī visā pasaulē. Raidījumu vada LTV Ziņu dienesta ārzemju ziņu redaktori Toms Pastors un Ina Strazdiņa.

programme.title: Aculiecinieks
programme.desc: 13 minūšu gari televīzijas stāsti vēsta par notikumiem un Latvijā īpašiem cilvēkiem, aptverot vēsturiskus, zinātnes, izglītības, pilsētas, lauku un daudzus citus tematus.

programme.title: Maikla Portillo garās nedēļas nogales
programme.desc: Maikls Portillo mūs ved uz savām iecienītajām Eiropas pilsētām: Madridi, Prāgu, Stokholmu, Lisabonu, Milānu un Palermo. Katrā raidījumā Maikls atklās noslēpumus, vietas un cilvēkus, kas šīs pilsētas padara unikālas, un izpētīs labākos restorānus, bārus, ēdienu tirgus un viesnīcas, kā arī vietas, ko ir iecienījuši vietējie iedzīvotāji. Maikls mūs iepazīstinās gan ar karaļu pilīm, katedrālēm, mākslas galerijām un muzejiem, gan ar mazāk pazīstamiem rajoniem prom no tūristu iecienītajām takām, un parādīs, kā tikai vienā nedēļas nogalē atklāt īsto pilsētu. Katrā pilsētā Maikls tiksies arī ar vietējiem iedzīvotājiem, kas viņam parādīs pilsētas apslēptos dārgumus.

programme.title: Kas notiek Latvijā?
programme.desc: Diskusijas un intervijas par sabiedrībai nozīmīgām norisēm. Vada žurnālists Jānis Domburs.

programme.title: Bēthovens
programme.desc: Pirmā filma kinofilmu sērijā par suni Bēthovenu. Izbēdzis no zooveikalu aptīrījušo nekrietno zagļu rokām, sanbernāra kucēns patveras Ņūtonu ģimenes mājā. Tam tiek dots dižā vācu komponista Bēthovena vārds. Draudzīgais suns palīdz Ņūtonu bērniem Raisai, Tedam un Emīlijai ikdienas gaitās un paglābj no dažādām nelaimēm. Mamma Alise atbalsta bērnu vēlmi paturēt suni, tomēr ģimenes tēva Džordža labvēlību Bēthovens iemanto krietni vēlāk, kad varonīgi stājas pretī nekrietnajiem investoriem un ļaunajam veterinārārstam Vornikam.

programme.title: Viesnīca pie jūras
programme.desc: Vajses radio paziņojums par zādzību tiek līdz dažiem vietējiem laikrakstiem, taču iemīļotais aktieris drīz vien nožēlo savu sasteigto lēmumu. Amanda nepacietīgi gaida ziņu no Ūves, tikmēr Ditmārs izlemj atklāt ko svarīgu, lai ko tas prasītu. Vai Klauss un Berta viņam palīdzēs? Madsens uzzina, kur Molīns dabūjis uzņēmumā investētos līdzekļus. Viesnīcā pie jūras noslēpumi cits pēc cita nāk gaismā, un viesiem ir vēl daudz kas darāms, pirms piedzīvojumu pilnais vasaras atvaļinājums ir beidzies.

programme.title: Daiļslidošana. Eiropas čempionāts Tallinā
programme.desc: Oficiālās sacensības beigušās, un šī sarīkojuma noslēgumā, kā vienmēr, notiek paraugdemonstrējumi. Spriedzes vairs nav, visi var slidot brīvi un atraisīti un izpildīt programmu pēc brīvas izvēles, tas ir īsts šovs. Paraugdemonstrējumos allaž piedalās visu disciplīnu laureāti, tāpat vēl daži citi atraktīvākie daiļslidotāji un arī mājinieki. Gandrīz vienmēr uz paraugdemonstrējumiem tiek uzaicināts arī mūsu Deniss Vasiļjevs, vienalga, vai viņš ir ticis pie medaļas vai ne. Vasiļjevs vienmēr slido ļoti atraktīvi, un tas patīk līdzjutējiem. Daudziem labākajiem sportistiem parasti jau ir sagatavotas īpašas programmas tieši šādiem slidojumiem, piemeklēti arī tērpi un atbilstoša mūzika, paši slidojumi notiek vairs ne pilnā apgaismojumā, un kopumā tas ir īsts baudījums visiem daiļslidošanas cienītājiem.

programme.title: Labākais no Euromaxx
programme.desc: Deutsche Welle žurnāls

programme.title: Latvijas Sirdsdziesma
programme.desc: Arī šajā raidījuma sezonā klausīsimies jaunas un skanīgas aptaujas dziesmas un dzīvosim līdzi jaunrades tapšanas stāstiem! Arī šajā gadā dosimies Latvijas ārēs satikt interesantus un muzikālus cilvēkus, kuri ir mums tepat, blakus!

programme.title: Skotijas skarbā un skaistā savvaļa
programme.desc: Skotijas piekrastē atrodas vairāk nekā 800 salu, un tikai 93 no tām apdzīvo cilvēki. Šeit valda liela bioloģiskā daudzveidība. Monahu salās patveras pelēkie roņi, bet Šentu salās - milzīgas putnu kolonijas. Šetlendas jūraszāļu mežos rotaļājas ūdri, bet Ramas salā dzīvo staltbriežu bars. Hebridu salās ir atgriezušies jūras ērgļi - šo sugu savulaik Lielbritānijā izmedīja līdz izmiršanai, bet mūsdienās tā piesaista dabas draugus no visas pasaules, skaidri pierādot, ka dabas atjaunošana sniedz arī ekonomisku labumu.

programme.title: Komisārs Reksis
programme.desc: Vairākas sievietes saņem anonīmus draudu zvanus, kas divos gadījumos noved pie nevainīgo nāves. Izmeklētājiem ir daudz mazsvarīgas informācijas un tikai nedaudzi vērtīgi pavedieni, to skaitā ļaundara balss ieraksts. Kamēr Brantnera komanda strādā ar dokumentu kalniem, lai nonāktu uz pareizajām pēdām, būs jāliek lietā tehnikas iespējas un Rekša izcilā dzirde, lai notvertu slepkavu, pirms iet bojā nākamā sieviete.

programme.title: Portugāle ar Maiklu Portillo
programme.desc: Portugāle strauji kļūst par tūristu iecienītu galamērķi, kas piesaista ne tikai ar saviem kūrortiem, pludmalēm un golfa laukumiem, bet arī ar sauli visa gada garumā, lielisku ēdienu un silto uzņemšanu. Maikls Portillo dodas ceļojumā no Portugāles ziemeļiem līdz dienvidiem un ārpus kontinenta, lai atklātu šīs valsts sirdi un dvēseli. Katrā Portugāles reģionā Maikls Portillo iepazīst maz zināmas vietas un atklāj daudz jauna par šķietami sen zināmo.

programme.title: Šerifs
programme.desc: Kapteinis Kaders Šerifs ļoti mīl savu darbu policijā. Viņš dzīvo tieši pretī policijas iecirknim. Gadiem zināms kā radikālu izmeklēšanas metožu piekritējs, Kaders sastopas ar jauno kapteini, Kadera partneri Adelīnu Briāru. Abi pretpoli, kuri tik ļoti darbā pievelkas, izrādās visai dinamisks policistu pāris! Alžīriešu izcelsmes franču aktieris Abdelhafids Metalsi televīzijā strādā kopš 2000. gadu sākuma, un šarmantais kapteinis Kaders ir viņa līdz šim spilgtākā loma.

programme.title: Policijas iecirknis
programme.desc: Stefans un Bruno mēģina nomierināt Katrinu Gamašu, kura ir sašutusi par policijas vilcināšanos viņas meitas Oseanas meklēšanā. Stefans izjautā Hu Sunu Čengu, bet Patriks uzdod pāris jautājumus fotogrāfam Normandenam, kurš atkal un atkal nonāk policijas redzeslokā.

programme.title: Policijas iecirknis
programme.desc: Seriāls "Policijas iecirknis 31" seko stāstam par detektīvseržanti Nadīnu Legrānu un viņas kolēģi Patriku Bisonē, kā arī citiem viņu biedriem policijas iecirknī, kur viņi sastopas ar ikdienas noziegumiem, kas notiek lielajās pilsētās: slepkavības, nolaupīšanas, ielaušanās, vardarbība ģimenē, narkotiku tirdzniecība, terorisms un daudz kas cits.

programme.title: Midsomeras slepkavības
programme.desc: Bārnabijs un Skots izmeklē Flečerkrsas ciemata apbedītāja Patrika Penimena slepkavību. Vīrieša sieva domā, ka viņš izdarījis pašnāvību, bet patologs konstatē, ka viņš ticis nogalināts. Vīrietis nomira drīz pēc atgriešanās mājās no dievkalpojuma vietējā spirituālistu baznīcā. Izmeklēšanai turpinoties, policija uzzina, ka Penimens nevienam nepatika. Bārnabijs uzskata, ka spirituālistu baznīcas galva ir šarlatāns, un, lai gan pastāv saikne ar arvien pieaugošo slepkavību upuru skaitu, noziegumu risinājums ir meklējams nelikumīgā mīlas dēkā.

programme.title: Labākais no Euromaxx
programme.desc: Deutsche Welle žurnāls

programme.title: Kas notiek Latvijā?
programme.desc: Diskusijas un intervijas par sabiedrībai nozīmīgām norisēm. Vada žurnālists Jānis Domburs.

programme.title: Sporta studija
programme.desc: "Mūsu uzņemtais virziens izsakāms neformālā sauklī "sports sabiedrībai!". Šis virziens tika uzsākts jau iepriekš ar "Tautas sporta" sižetu sērijām un sporta laukumu kampaņām. Turpmāk LTV Tautas sporta sižeti būs tradicionāla "Sporta studijas" sastāvdaļa. "Sporta Studiju" vadīs rūdītie sporta žurnālisti Dāvids Ernštreits un Reinis Ošenieks, kā arī jaunās sporta žurnālistikas zvaigznes Andris Auziņš, Matīss Timofejevs un Raimonds Gekišs. "Sporta studijas" aktualitātēm sekojiet https://www.facebook.com/LTVSportaStudija

programme.title: Daudz laimes, jubilār!
programme.desc: Andrejs Osokins, viens no mūzikas pasaulē labi zināmās pianistu Osokinu dzimtas, daudzkārtējs starptautisku konkursu laureāts, savas personības ietilpībā un pienesumā visplašākajai sabiedrībai ir kas vairāk par mūzikas izcilību. Turpinādams savas dzimtas tradīciju, viņš ne tikai pārstāv humānisma un cilvēkmīlestības filozofiju, bet ievērojami paplašina to, īpaši atbalstā Ukrainas tautai. Visā Latvijā cilvēki zina mākslinieka izveidoto Osokina fondu un viņa organizēto ikgadējo pasākumu ciklu, ko viņš nosaucis ļoti iedvesmojoši - "Brīvības festivāls". Tieši savā dzimšanas dienā Andrejs Osokins viesojas raidījumā "Daudz laimes, jubilār!", kur kā trešais sarunas partneris filmēšanas gaismās spoguļojas un mākslinieka domu ilustrē melni glancētais flīģelis.

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: Turkish Airlines Flight 1951 was less than a mile from the runway at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport when it catastrophically crashed on 25 February 2009. The aircraft broke into three pieces on impact, killing nine passengers and crew and all three pilots. A faulty radio altimeter was the initial catalyst in a chain of errors that led to the horrific crash. In this episode, survivors tell their story of escaping from the wreckage of what should have been a normal commute home to Amsterdam..

programme.title: Disaster Autopsy
programme.desc: Three real world disasters forensically dissected, analysed and recreated in astonishing detail from expert analysis using all the evidence. How did the shuttle Columbia tear itself to pieces during reentry? Why did so many die in the worst high speed train crash in history at Eschede in Germany? How did a concrete high rise in London called Grenfell Tower become an inferno that killed 72?

programme.title: Colossal Machines
programme.desc: In this programme, we examine the science behind some of the worlds most impressive, technologically advanced machines. What big ideas drove their evolution? How do they actually work? What sets each machine apart? Follow along for all the fascinating stories as we reveal the best-kept mechanical secrets that not only made these extraordinary machines work, but also changed the world in a big way.

programme.title: One Strange Rock
programme.desc: Earth protects itself from the sun. The David and Goliath story of Earths relationship with its greatest threat, our seemingly benign Sun. The Sun is the big violent boss of the Solar System throwing out devastating particles and deadly radiation. Without several shields, one generated by our unique planetary core, another by our atmosphere, and a third by our interconnected weather systems, life on Earth would never have survived.

programme.title: One Strange Rock
programme.desc: For the privileged few who have looked down at the Earth from space, the thin blue line of our planets sets the Earth apart from every other planet weve seen. It sustains life. The story of how the Earth creates and regulates that oxygen rich-atmosphere is mind-blowing: A flying river, a global dust storm, a collapsing glacier and the most important creature youve never heard of. All connected together to allow life and the planet to breathe.

programme.title: One Strange Rock
programme.desc: For the privileged few who have looked down at the Earth from space, the thin blue line of our planets sets the Earth apart from every other planet weve seen. It sustains life. The story of how the Earth creates and regulates that oxygen rich-atmosphere is mind-blowing: A flying river, a global dust storm, a collapsing glacier and the most important creature youve never heard of. All connected together to allow life and the planet to breathe.

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation Special Report
programme.desc: Some of the deadliest air crashes in history have been caused by simple misunderstandings, and its a tiny error in the cockpit that brought tragedy to Quincy Airport in Illinois. Meanwhile, a minor mistake, a non-standard approach, and heavy smoke add up to a tragic misunderstanding that cost the lives of everyone on board Garuda Indonesia Flight 152. And, however disastrous, never has a misunderstanding taken as devastating a turn as on the island of Tenerife and the single deadliest aviation accident of all time.

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation Special Report
programme.desc: It takes years of training to become an airline captain, but its when a crisis strikes that a pilot really earns his stripes. An airliner is crippled after takeoff from New Yorks LaGuardia Airport, and the courageous captain pulls off an amphibious landing in the Hudson River. A catastrophic failure strikes high above the Canadian Prairies turning a Boeing 767 into a very large and very heavy glider. And, when the engines of TACA Flight 110 flame out in a violent storm, its captain pulls off one of the most remarkable landings in the history of commercial aviation.

programme.title: Science of Stupid
programme.desc: Science of Stupid, series 8. Dallas Campbell hosts the show that combines serious science with some of the craziest, most spectacular user generated clips ever recorded. In each programme we show 40 to 50 clips of misadventure: ordinary folk making extraordinary mistakes and paying the price. We analyse the science behind the mishaps, with the help of bespoke animation and super slow-motion cinematography.

programme.title: The Space Race
programme.desc: THE SPACE RACE uncovers the little-known story behind the race to put the first black man into space, a complex web of Cold War propaganda and Civil Rights mishaps that span the United States, Russia, and Cuba. Referred to by historians as "the last battle of the cold war," well hear from three men who were championed and often used by each country as tokens in an ideological war that shaped our history.

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: On 17 January 2008, British Airways Flight 38 was approaching London Heathrow Airport when it crashed just short of the runway. The uneventful passenger flight from Beijing, China turned almost fatal when a lack of power to both engines caused the Boeing 777 to crash. Quick thinking by the crew and Captain Peter Burkill prevented the incident from being fatal and saved all 152 people on board.

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation
programme.desc: En route from Moscow to Perm, Russia, Aeroflot Nord Flight 821 is on its final approach when the plane nosedives and crashes onto the trans-Siberian railway. All thats left of the Boeing 737 is charred wreckage. All 88 people on board are confirmed dead. At first, investigators suspect a known design flaw in the aircrafts rudder. But as they dig deeper, they make a series of shocking discoveries that will result in calls to transform the countrys aviation system.

programme.title: Disaster Autopsy
programme.desc: Three real world disasters forensically dissected, analysed and recreated in astonishing detail from expert analysis using all the evidence. How did a Titan II nuclear missile explode in its Arkansas silo? What flaw made the sinking of the ferry Estonia the worst European maritime disaster since Titanic? Why did the oil rig Piper Alpha explode; the most lethal offshore accident in history?

programme.title: Colossal Machines
programme.desc: The need for speed has been met with a new superclass of machines. It is expected that they will have to go farther, higher and, most of all, faster. Experts investigate the construction and design of some of the most incredible speed machines in the world.

programme.title: The Infinite Explorer with Hannah Fry
programme.desc: Ireland doesnt take up much room on the map, but few places have such a celebrated identity; over 70 million people around the world claim Irish heritage. Hannah Fry goes beyond the pubs and parades to discover what it really means to be Irish today. Along the windswept coast of Donegal Bay, she dives into Irelands surprising surfing scene, where dramatic geology is forging a new bond with the sea. She places a bet at the Punchestown races, exploring how a connection to the land became a multi-billion Euro industry. In a moment of personal discovery, Hannah uncovers her own Irish DNA and how her family history holds clues to Irish identity. As her journey ends, Hannah steps into the spotlight to try her hand at one of Irelands most cherished traditions: storytelling.

programme.title: The Infinite Explorer with Hannah Fry
programme.desc: Hannah Fry visits Iceland to discover how this stark, treeless island became a global success story. On the geologically active Reykjanes Peninsula, she meets scientists whose lava-flow predictions saved the world-famous Blue Lagoon spa from destruction, and in Hengill she sees how a futuristic algae farm is fuelled by geothermal power - and imagination. A dip in the countrys oldest swimming pool reveals how Icelands unusually small gene pool is helping advance global health, while a horseback ride across a black sand landscape immortalised in the Icelandic sagas shows how Viking heritage continues to inspire creativity. The Icelanders Hannah encounters dont just live on the land; they negotiate with it. Their collective determination and adaptability has forged an island of ideas - and a tourist magnet the world cannot resist.

programme.title: Ancient X Files
programme.desc: The ancient Incas ruled over most of South America 500 years ago. Their empire spanned the continent with roads, temples and mysterious cities built to incredible precision. Amazingly they achieved it all without a written language. Archaeologists today believe they may have discovered how this ancient civilization communicated. And it could be a three dimensional language - made from knots. Anthropologist Dr Sabine Hyland attempts to decode the sacred knotted relics known as khipus, and crack the intricate code of the Incas. Also in this episode the Vikings. They were a feared race of seafaring warriors, with powers of navigation far ahead of their time. They discovered America almost 500 years before Columbus. But how did they cross vast oceans to raid, trade and plunder? What was their secret?

programme.title: Incas: The Rise and Fall
programme.desc: The Inca Empire rose in the 15th century, yet its origins remained shrouded in mystery for centuries. Follow Manco Capac, the first Inca and Pachacutec, the mythical emperor who reshaped a civilization. Pachacutec built Machu Picchu, revolutionized architecture, and drew on the legacy of an older society to rewrite his peoples history. Claiming the title "Son of the Sun," he expanded the empire beyond the Cuzco Valley, imposed a solar cult as the state religion, and even instituted human sacrifices to assert his power. With cutting-edge science and ultra-realistic 3D reconstructions from Machu Picchu to Chilean volcanoes, Lake Titicaca, and Cuzco, witness the breathtaking birth of the Empire of the Sun.

programme.title: Drain the Oceans
programme.desc: Extreme weather patterns have threatened ships and mariners for centuries. The perfect storm?. towering walls of water, powerful winds and churning seas can overwhelm any ship. What brought down the largest haul of Spanish treasure off the coast of Florida? And whats the truth behind the strange disappearance of the mightiest invasion force of ancient times? Drain the Oceans reveals the secrets of Stormy Seas.

programme.title: Drain the Oceans
programme.desc: Extreme weather patterns have threatened ships and mariners for centuries. The perfect storm?. towering walls of water, powerful winds and churning seas can overwhelm any ship. What brought down the largest haul of Spanish treasure off the coast of Florida? And whats the truth behind the strange disappearance of the mightiest invasion force of ancient times? Drain the Oceans reveals the secrets of Stormy Seas.

programme.title: Drain the Oceans
programme.desc: Extreme weather patterns have threatened ships and mariners for centuries. The perfect storm?. towering walls of water, powerful winds and churning seas can overwhelm any ship. What brought down the largest haul of Spanish treasure off the coast of Florida? And whats the truth behind the strange disappearance of the mightiest invasion force of ancient times? Drain the Oceans reveals the secrets of Stormy Seas.

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation Special Report
programme.desc: November 12th, 1996 - Shortly after take off from New Delhi, Saudi Airways Flight 763 levels off at 14,000 feet. As the crew waits for clearance to climb to their cruising altitude, the plane is hit by a Kazakhstan Airlines jet. The collision cripples both planes. They spiral violently to the ground, killing all 349 people on board. Its the worst mid-air collision in the history of aviation. The two wreckage fields are five miles apart. As investigators comb through the charred debris for evidence, they try and answer troubling questions: Why did the two planes collide? Whos responsible? And can they stop it before it happens again?

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation
programme.desc: En route from Moscow to Perm, Russia, Aeroflot Nord Flight 821 is on its final approach when the plane nosedives and crashes onto the trans-Siberian railway. All thats left of the Boeing 737 is charred wreckage. All 88 people on board are confirmed dead. At first, investigators suspect a known design flaw in the aircrafts rudder. But as they dig deeper, they make a series of shocking discoveries that will result in calls to transform the countrys aviation system.

programme.title: Ice Road Rescue: Highway Havoc!
programme.desc: Journey through the unforgiving and inhospitable climate of Norways frozen mountains with the elite rescue crews who come to the aid of stranded travellers and battle round-the-clock to maintain access to vital road links. With sudden changes in the weather, from torrential rain to snow blizzards and sudden temperature changes, the teams have their work cut out for them. Risking life and limb in some of Europes harshest conditions, it takes a special breed of men and women to overcome the many challenges thay face on a daily basis. As the roads turn into icy bobsleigh tracks, haulage container vehicles and private cars and vans all get themselves into difficulties and need to be rescued by our road warrior heroes.

programme.title: Ice Road Rescue: Highway Havoc!
programme.desc: Journey through the unforgiving and inhospitable climate of Norways frozen mountains with the elite rescue crews who come to the aid of stranded travellers and battle round-the-clock to maintain access to vital road links. With sudden changes in the weather, from torrential rain to snow blizzards and sudden temperature changes, the teams have their work cut out for them. Risking life and limb in some of Europes harshest conditions, it takes a special breed of men and women to overcome the many challenges thay face on a daily basis. As the roads turn into icy bobsleigh tracks, haulage container vehicles and private cars and vans all get themselves into difficulties and need to be rescued by our road warrior heroes.

programme.title: Top Guns: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The students face their final test in an iconic head-to-head dogfight against their instructors. To pass, they must bring all the skills they have learned during their advanced phase training. With graduation just days away, students start to worry about their final grades and whether they will get the posting they—and in many cases, their families—want.

programme.title: Top Guns: The Next Generation
programme.desc: In the high-octane competitive world of the U.S. Navys toughest fighter pilot school, only the strong succeed. This world exclusive takes the viewer inside the final grueling six months of training and selection, where the students learn how to fly combat missions. Dreams of earning strike pilot wings collide with the harsh reality of the most rigorous tests yet. We are inside the cockpit as they tackle adrenaline-fueled, dynamic aerial tests, each designed to push the students to their limits and beyond and not all will pass the test.

programme.title: The Infinite Explorer with Hannah Fry
programme.desc: Hannah Fry travels to Vietnam, a land of staggering natural beauty, ancient traditions and some of the fastest growing skylines on earth. Over 1,600 km from the vibrant South to the historic North, she uncovers the story of the countrys remarkable post-war transformation. She immerses herself in the moped chaos in Ho Chi Minh City, helps with a muddy prawn harvest in the Mekong Delta and takes a restorative spa bath in the misty hilltops of Sapa. She ushers in the New Year with a local family celebrating the Tet festival and learns how a beloved dish, pho, tells a story of identity. In each place she visits, she meets characters whose lives have been shaped by both war and renewal. What emerges is a nation embracing change, where striking contrasts are balanced by a spirit of cooperation and strong family bonds.

programme.title: The Infinite Explorer with Hannah Fry
programme.desc: Hannah Fry decodes Spains cultural contradictions. Starting in Madrid, she tries her hand at flamenco and learns how the artform combines both technical discipline and the freedom of improvisation. In Valencia she reveals the origins of paella - a fiercely regional dish that owes its existence to an irrigation system built by invaders from Africa over 700 years ago. In the Canary Islands, where Christoper Colombus first set sail for the Americas, she discovers an ancient whistling language which endured as Spanish conquered the world. Back on the mainland she indulges her love of urban planning in Barcelona, revealing how much of the citys easy charm is built on strict geometric discipline. And in a heart stopping finale, she witnesses the strong community bonds at the heart of gravity-defying human pyramids.

programme.title: To Catch a Smuggler
programme.desc: CBP Nogales stops a pedestrian carrying fentanyl internally and seizes a vehicle with a mixed load of heroin and fentanyl with a combined street value of over $760,000. In San Diego, CBP officers empty a gas tank filled with 35 packages of meth, all tied together for quick retrieval. Spring breakers return to Atlantas airport with varying contraband, including $38,000 of undeclared cash inside a bag of dirty laundry.

programme.title: To Catch a Smuggler
programme.desc: Even during a pandemic, smuggling never stops. After adjusting tactics in the early days of the COVID crisis to meet the increasing flow of narcotics coming across our southern land borders, the Department of Homeland Security is now pivoting back to our nations airports where international travel is starting to rev back up again. Whether narco-traffickers try to slip through an airport, seaport or land crossing, vigilant officers are on high-alert to stem the flow of illegal contraband. Using every tool available to them, DHS will stop at nothing to catch a smuggler.

programme.title: To Catch a Smuggler: JFK Airport
programme.desc: HSI Miami investigates two separate maritime smuggling cases, and seizes more than 450 kilograms of cocaine off of a yacht bringing-in drugs from the Caribbean. CBP cracks down on the illegal importation of prescription medications, due to concerns for peoples health and safety. And HSI New York arrests a cocaine courier fromCuracao, as part of a two-year investigation into a large-scale drug smuggling organization. APPROVEDLine Description: HSI pursues multiple cases of cocaine smuggled from the Caribbean aboard boats. CBP makes large-scale seizures of medications without aprescription.

programme.desc: Even during a pandemic, smuggling never stops. Whether narco-traffickers try to slip through an airport, seaport or land crossing, vigilant officers are on high-alert to stem the flow of illegal contraband. programme.title: Disaster Autopsy
programme.desc: Three real world disasters forensically dissected, analysed and recreated in astonishing detail from expert analysis using all the evidence. How did the shuttle Columbia tear itself to pieces during reentry? Why did so many die in the worst high speed train crash in history at Eschede in Germany? How did a concrete high rise in London called Grenfell Tower become an inferno that killed 72?

programme.title: Disaster Autopsy
programme.desc: Three real world disasters forensically dissected, analysed and recreated in astonishing detail from expert analysis using all the evidence. How did a Titan II nuclear missile explode in its Arkansas silo? What flaw made the sinking of the ferry Estonia the worst European maritime disaster since Titanic? Why did the oil rig Piper Alpha explode; the most lethal offshore accident in history?

programme.title: Disaster Autopsy
programme.desc: Three real world disasters forensically analysed and recreated in astonishing detail from expert analysis and all the evidence. How did the nuclear reactor at 3 Mile Island meltdown? How did a small truck fire in the Mt Blanc road tunnel become a lethal inferno? How did the seven year old Sampoong department store in South Korea collapse onto hundreds of shoppers?

programme.title: Food Factory USA
programme.desc: On this episode of Food Factory USA: White Castle has sold more than three billion of its frozen cheeseburger sliders; it takes three kinds of chilies to give Red Gold Salsa its signature zing; and, visit the century-old family business that turns out delectable chocolate-covered Cordial Cherries.

programme.title: Food Factory USA
programme.desc: On this episode of Food Factory USA: Make the pilgrimage to the Budweiser Brewing Companys St. Louis headquarters; meet the cryogenic processor behind Dippin Dots revolutionary ice cream beads; and visit the California bakery that turns out over 80,000 carrot cakes with cream-cheese icing every day

programme.title: Food Factory USA
programme.desc: On this episode of Food Factory USA: Journey through the town of Mt. Olive, where there are no mountains or olives, but plenty of pickled peppers; discover the simple yet key ingredient to New Yorker Bagels everything bagel; and find out what makes Barber Foods frozen stuffed chicken breasts so iconic.

programme.title: Food Factory USA
programme.desc: Food Factory USA samples some of the tastiest treats in Pennsylvania: Discover what a laser beam and applesauce have in common; learn the trick to making ultra-creamy fudge; and this snack factory produces a billion onion rings every year.

programme.title: Explorer
programme.desc: Hosted by Phil Keoghan, National Geographics flagship series Explorer investigates global stories of science, nature and culture. It is the longest-running documentary series on cable and recipient of 52 Emmy Awards, 13 Cable ACE awards, the Genesis and Peabody Awards, and twice nominated for Academy Awards. Newly reformatted as a weekly 1-hour magazine series, episodes air in 171 countries in 45 languages and supported by 440 million viewers.

programme.title: Explorer
programme.desc: Phil Keoghan journeys to the Atacama Desert to visit Paranal Observatory. Mariana van Zeller heads to California to speak with members of the growing Flat Earth movement, and a group of volunteers trying to debunk their claims. Albert Lin explores a new frontier in humans ambition to travel to Mars - hibernation - and how lemurs can help. Cara Santa Maria explores the world of meteorite trading in Morocco and what it means for space research.

programme.title: Amsterdam Central 24/7
programme.desc: During the Dutch F1 Grand Prix, Amsterdam Central will have to deal with 60,000 racing fanatics. They will depart throughout the morning, but will all come back at the same time. For Traffic Control and the station employees, it is all hands-on deck to manage the enormous flow of people. While people are trying to prevent passenger congestion, the shops are waiting for their delayed goods.

programme.title: Amsterdam Central 24/7
programme.desc: Kings Day is the busiest day of the year at Amsterdam Central Station. While Ticket and Services employee Alexandra, and Station Manager Rene try to steer the crowds in the right direction, Assistant Manager Michel is busy coordinating the flow of goods due to a broken freight elevator. Meanwhile, officers Menno and Carolien revive a girl who has fallen ill.

programme.title: Europe from Above
programme.desc: This spectacular aerial tour reveals Iberia as its never been seen before. Flying cameras uncover a jaw-dropping window cleaning operation in Benidorm, a vibrant flower parade in the Spanish city of Valencia and a trip around Portugals capital Lisbon on one of its famous trams. Well take a trip on the worlds longest alpine rollercoaster and witness the biggest Christmas tree in Europe as it lights up the winter Cantabrian skies.

programme.title: Europe from Above
programme.desc: This spectacular aerial journey reveals Serbia as its never been seen before. Drone cameras soar over a village with a unique way of harvesting its peppers, reveal avant-garde monuments secretly studded in remote hills and fly with exclusive access over a special animal conservation effort. Well explore all four corners of this nation, from the construction of a record-breaking skyscraper to a fairy-tale synagogue unlike any other.

programme.title: Europe from Above
programme.desc: Europe from Above takes to the air over Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Spain and the UK to showcase Europes finest cultural and geographical landmarks as youve never seen them before. Stunning aerial hyper-lapse photography allows us to visualise the changes of a season in seconds, as tulip fields in the Netherlands magically burst into colour and waterfalls in the Dolomites turn to ice. We reveal how tradition, engineering and natural wonders have shaped this epic continent - a vibrant portrait of these regions and the people who keep their traditions alive.

programme.title: Lost Cities with Albert Lin
programme.desc: Lost Cities combines hi-tech archaeology, breath-taking visuals and genuine exploration to make headline-grabbing discoveries. Lost Cities brings adventure, science and archaeology together through our host Albert Lin. Our ambitious approach applies 3D scanning to some of the most extraordinary sites of antiquity. This series will deliver powerful, emotional stories with hi-tech imagery to bring the mysteries of the past vividly to life.

programme.title: Lost Cities with Albert Lin
programme.desc: Dr Allan Maca explores a newly discovered ancient megacity that 4000 years ago was one of the biggest on the planet. Its people created amazing Maya-like carvings like nothing ever found in China before. Theres also grizzly evidence of human sacrifice on an unprecedented scale. This lost civilisation changes everything we thought we knew about the origins of China, but why, after 500 years, did they vanish? Allan and his team investigate ancient cataclysms to try to solve this great mystery.

programme.title: Ancient X Files
programme.desc: The ancient Incas ruled over most of South America 500 years ago. Their empire spanned the continent with roads, temples and mysterious cities built to incredible precision. Amazingly they achieved it all without a written language. Archaeologists today believe they may have discovered how this ancient civilization communicated. And it could be a three dimensional language - made from knots. Anthropologist Dr Sabine Hyland attempts to decode the sacred knotted relics known as khipus, and crack the intricate code of the Incas. Also in this episode the Vikings. They were a feared race of seafaring warriors, with powers of navigation far ahead of their time. They discovered America almost 500 years before Columbus. But how did they cross vast oceans to raid, trade and plunder? What was their secret?

programme.title: Incas: The Rise and Fall
programme.desc: The Inca Empire rose in the 15th century, yet its origins remained shrouded in mystery for centuries. Follow Manco Capac, the first Inca and Pachacutec, the mythical emperor who reshaped a civilization. Pachacutec built Machu Picchu, revolutionized architecture, and drew on the legacy of an older society to rewrite his peoples history. Claiming the title "Son of the Sun," he expanded the empire beyond the Cuzco Valley, imposed a solar cult as the state religion, and even instituted human sacrifices to assert his power. With cutting-edge science and ultra-realistic 3D reconstructions from Machu Picchu to Chilean volcanoes, Lake Titicaca, and Cuzco, witness the breathtaking birth of the Empire of the Sun.

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation
programme.desc: Every time a plane crashes, the world takes notice. And so do the experts whose job it is to figure out what happened. Air Crash Investigation uncovers the truth behind the most legendary aviation disasters, and every episode features eyewitness accounts, captivating reenactments, state-of-the-art CGI, and interviews with the investigators who ultimately determined what went wrong. This season on Air Crash Investigation: Conflicting stories emerge after a Swedish cargo plane spirals to the ground; an African airliner crashes in the wilderness and the cause proves too sinister to be believed; and, when a Pakistani passenger jet disappears on approach to Kathmandu, Nepalese investigators must determine how it ended up on a crash course with the Himalayas.

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation
programme.desc: Every time a plane crashes, the world takes notice. And so do the experts whose job it is to figure out what happened. Air Crash Investigation uncovers the truth behind the most legendary aviation disasters, and every episode features eyewitness accounts, captivating reenactments, state-of-the-art CGI, and interviews with the investigators who ultimately determined what went wrong. programme.title: Genghis Khan: The Secret History of the Mongols
programme.desc: After Chinggis Khans secret burial, his son Ogedei is proclaimed ruler of the Mongol Empire. He brings a very different leadership style as he conquers Armenia, Georgia and the Jin Empire. He orders the building of the grand capital of Karakorum and sets the stage for a brutal campaign against Kievan Rus, led by his nephew Batu and the veteran general Subudai.

programme.title: Genghis Khan: The Secret History of the Mongols
programme.desc: The Mongolian Empire launched a devastating campaign through the lands of Russia and Europe, crushing knights with Mongol speed and strategy. As they prepared to push deeper into Europe, news of Ogedeis death halted the advance, triggering a struggle for succession over an empire that now stretched from China to Europe, the largest the world had ever seen.

programme.title: Lost Temple of the Inca
programme.desc: Legendary archeologist Johan Reinhard spent his career searching for the lost temples of the Inca Empire, discovering all but one: Ausangate, named after one of the most sacred mountains in Peru. Now in his seventies, hes handed the torch to environmental scientist Preston Sowell, who makes a mysterious discovery at an alpine lake near Mt Ausangate that he believes is the lost temple. This film follows Sowells journey of discovery, loss and adventure as he seeks the truth about this sacred place.

programme.title: Incas: The Rise and Fall
programme.desc: The Inca Empire rose in the 15th century, yet its origins remained shrouded in mystery for centuries. Follow Manco Capac, the first Inca and Pachacutec, the mythical emperor who reshaped a civilization. Pachacutec built Machu Picchu, revolutionized architecture, and drew on the legacy of an older society to rewrite his peoples history. Claiming the title "Son of the Sun," he expanded the empire beyond the Cuzco Valley, imposed a solar cult as the state religion, and even instituted human sacrifices to assert his power. With cutting-edge science and ultra-realistic 3D reconstructions from Machu Picchu to Chilean volcanoes, Lake Titicaca, and Cuzco, witness the breathtaking birth of the Empire of the Sun.

programme.title: Incas: The Rise and Fall
programme.desc: In less than a century, the Incas built monumental remains throughout their vast empire, but the secrets of their lightning-fast expansion remained unknown for centuries. Under the conqueror Tupac Yupanqui, the empire grew through force and clever alliances. He led the greatest territorial expansion of the Inca realm. He subdued the Incas fiercest rivals along the Pacific coast. From Cuzco, the heart of his empire, he also established a vast imperial administration, supported by a 40,000-kilometer road network, custom-built administrative centers, and a curious accounting system based on knotted strings. Thanks to the latest scientific advances and ultra-realistic 3D reconstructions from Cuzco to the Atacama Desert, via the Pacific coast, this is the lightning expansion of the Empire of the Sun.

programme.title: Rise and Fall of the Maya
programme.desc: In the forests of southern Mexico and Central America early explorers discovered long abandoned, ancient cities. Vast complexes filled with towering pyramids and mysterious carvings. There were built by the Maya, only to be deserted around 900 AD. The mystery of why has long puzzled archaeologists. Now, teams of investigators are on a mission to solve the mystery of an event that has become known as the collapse. In the rainforest of Guatemala, teams exploring the lost city of Tikal have uncovered evidence of huge manmade reservoirs. The discoveries highlight the Maya reliance on water. The rainforest might have abundant water in the rainy season, but for months every year its incredibly dry. Now scientists are forensically examining the ancient reservoirs and discovering surprising evidence of toxic contaminants.

programme.title: Rise and Fall of the Maya
programme.desc: For centuries, historians thought that the ancient Maya were a lost civilization, that the cities abandoned in the ninth century in Mexico and central America were the last great pinnacle of their society. Now, teams of archaeologists, using new technology, are finding evidence of a Maya resurgence, including vast new cities with ingenious pyramids constructed to align to the sun. But a perfect storm of disasters was about to push the society to its limits once more. Scientists venturing deep into underground cave systems find evidence of catastrophic drought; divers expose the dark secrets of disease as they uncover grisly remains hidden in water filled caverns, and archaeologists uncover clues that point to violent civil war in the last Maya capital of the Yucatan.

programme.title: Incas: The Rise and Fall
programme.desc: In less than a century, the Incas built monumental remains throughout their vast empire, but the secrets of their lightning-fast expansion remained unknown for centuries. programme.title: Disaster Autopsy
programme.desc: Three real world disasters forensically dissected, analysed and recreated in astonishing detail from expert analysis using all the evidence. Why did Fukushimas nuclear plant meltdown and explode after a massive earthquake? How did a 200ft tall tower crane collapse onto the Manhattan streets? Why did the USS Forrestal, Americas flagship aircraft carrier, explode killing 134 crew?

programme.title: Disaster Autopsy
programme.desc: Three real world disasters forensically analysed and recreated in astonishing detail from expert analysis and all the evidence. Why did Deepwater Horizon explode causing the worst manmade oil spill in history? Why did the Air France Concorde crash barely a minute after take off? How did so many people die in an Austrian funicular trip up the inside of a mountain at Kaprun?

programme.title: Inside Melbourne Airport
programme.desc: The Australian Border Force investigates potential criminal activity on the tarmac. Emergency Planning Manager Riki oversees a multi-agency operation to repatriate 241 passengers arriving from Lebanon. Vision-impaired passenger Ninas assistance dog Nixon makes his final flight before he retires, Melbourne Cup runner up Warp Speed heads back to Japan.

programme.title: Inside Melbourne Airport
programme.desc: Dangerous weapons concealed in luggage test airport security. Paramedics rush to treat a passenger suspected of having a stroke. A large group of VIPs require special attention, and a secret world beneath the terminals is revealed for the first time. Elsewhere, the hunt is on for the perfect aviation photograph.

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation
programme.desc: Every time a plane crashes, the world takes notice. And so do the experts whose job it is to figure out what happened. Air Crash Investigation uncovers the truth behind the most legendary aviation disasters, and every episode features eyewitness accounts, captivating reenactments, state-of-the-art CGI, and interviews with the investigators who ultimately determined what went wrong. This season on Air Crash Investigation: Conflicting stories emerge after a Swedish cargo plane spirals to the ground; an African airliner crashes in the wilderness and the cause proves too sinister to be believed; and, when a Pakistani passenger jet disappears on approach to Kathmandu, Nepalese investigators must determine how it ended up on a crash course with the Himalayas.

programme.title: Hunters of the Reef
programme.desc: Tropical coral reefs are the picture of colorful, light-dappled tranquility - but thats a scuba divers perspective. To the scaly and gilled inhabitants, its a fish-eat-fish environment ruled by pods of dolphins who prowl the area at mealtimes while everyone else runs for cover. Incredible weapons, camouflage, venomous defenses and exceptional strategies have evolved among the smaller hunters in constant competition. Lionfish hunt in packs, injecting any objectors with venom from their frilly spikes. The mantis shrimp has polarized vision and the fastest jab on the planet. Cuttlefish morph their skin to match the sand, then attack with tentacle harpoons. The hunt is on in the shifting tides!

programme.title: Secrets of the Octopus
programme.desc: Octopus are like aliens on earth but they have one superpower that we are only now beginning to fully appreciate. By changing their color hundreds of times an hour, or transforming the shape of their bodies to mimic their deadliest enemies, octopus are the most extraordinary shapeshifters on the planet.

programme.title: Secrets of the Octopus
programme.desc: Octopuses break all the rules on animal intelligence. Born into the world as orphans, they are self-taught masterminds; capable of solving complex problems, strategizing, even planning for the future. Extraordinary superpowers that are the secret to their success.

programme.title: Secrets of the Octopus
programme.desc: Octopuses were always thought to be natures ultimate loners, preferring their own company. The truth is they have secret social lives. From moms to be hanging out in the deep in their hundreds to an octopus capable of coworking with another species. These aliens of nature are more sociable than ever imagined.

programme.title: Secrets of the Octopus
programme.desc: Octopus are like aliens on earth but they have one superpower that we are only now beginning to fully appreciate. By changing their color hundreds of times an hour, or transforming the shape of their bodies to mimic their deadliest enemies, octopus are the most extraordinary shapeshifters on the planet.

programme.title: Asias Killer Hornets
programme.desc: Every Asian giant hornet colony starts with a single queen. Leaving one hive to start another, shell quickly transform an empty lair into a bustling army of ruthless, efficient killing machines. These hornets will sacrifice everything to help raise legions of grubs and protect the hive at all costs.

programme.title: Asias Weirdest
programme.desc: Asias natural world is full of weird wildlife. The largest continent on Earth has more than its fair share of peculiar plants and abnormal animals, and this documentary series delves deep into its wild landscapes to reveal some of the strangest species on offer. Expect the unexpected in places like no other, as the series heads to extraordinary locations including the rugged islands of Indonesia and the grasslands of Mongolia.

programme.title: Secrets of the Octopus
programme.desc: Octopus are like aliens on earth but they have one superpower that we are only now beginning to fully appreciate. By changing their color hundreds of times an hour, or transforming the shape of their bodies to mimic their deadliest enemies, octopus are the most extraordinary shapeshifters on the planet.

programme.title: Asias Killer Hornets
programme.desc: Every Asian giant hornet colony starts with a single queen. Leaving one hive to start another, shell quickly transform an empty lair into a bustling army of ruthless, efficient killing machines. These hornets will sacrifice everything to help raise legions of grubs and protect the hive at all costs.

programme.title: Kingdom of the White Wolf
programme.desc: Join Ronan Donovan, a National Geographic Explorer and photographer, as he takes the viewer on a unique adventure to track down the hard-to-find Arctic wolf. The series follows the year-long travails of a family of Arctic wolves on Ellesmere Island, from the first breaking light after the long winter, through the life-bringing springtime, the fattening summer months and the preparations of autumn. Each episode deals with different obstacles that the wolves face and have to overcome and, along the way, we the various characters and personalities of the animal family are revealed. The show makes good use of intimate footage to make the viewer feel that they are actually there, observing the creatures up close.

programme.title: Trials of the Wild
programme.desc: Watch a range of wild animals trying to survive in the wilderness as they migrate, hunt and defend themselves against predators and the dangers that are living alongside them. Follow animals born to fight to those designed to live in the canopy of trees as the series gives you an insight into natures greatest spectacles from around the world on land, water and air. This nature documentary is intriguing and engaging as they examine a range of species and how they survive in the most brutal environments.

programme.title: Secrets of the Penguins
programme.desc: Millions of years ago, a group of penguins left the ice in search of more. Riding powerful currents, the tiny adventurers arrived in strange new lands, reshaping traditions for deserts, tropics … and even among humans. They were tested to the extreme, becoming perhaps the smartest of them all. National Geographic Explorer Bertie Gregory discovers penguin problem solving, talking, and their enduring search for new worlds.

programme.title: Winters Hidden Wonders
programme.desc: Winter is the most punishing of seasons, a time of year when many animals seek shelter in order to hibernate, but others must face the harshness of their environment. This documentary series showcases the ruthless beauty of this icy season, revealing the animals who thrive in their freezing conditions and the animals who simply fight for survival. When the season finally passes spring is reborn, and it is a celebration for those who managed to survive unscathed.

programme.title: Kingdom of the White Wolf
programme.desc: Join Ronan Donovan, a National Geographic Explorer and photographer, as he takes the viewer on a unique adventure to track down the hard-to-find Arctic wolf. programme.title: Sharks Up Close with Bertie Gregory
programme.desc: Bertie heads to South Africa for his most dangerous mission yet. The wild waters here are a hotspot for one of the oceans most famous and fearsome predators: the great white shark. Bertie will attempt to film them hunting seals underwater without the use of a protective cage. Its highly risky, but filming without the cage is the very best way to see them behaving naturally.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Reality show follows Dutch-born veterinarian Jan Pol, his family and employees everyday. Jan Pol and his wife Diane started their own practice in Weidman, Michigan, Pol Veterinary Services, back in in 1981. Dr Pol takes a good care of every family pet and head of livestock no matter what size or condition and is a true legend in the community. Dr Pol has seen it all, treating numerous patients every single day, his daily routine is more than 12 hours but nothing can stop him from being devoted to his patients.

programme.title: Incredible Animal Journeys
programme.desc: The Arctic is a tough place to be a parent, even tougher when you have to lead your family on an epic journey to survive. From the polar bear mom guiding her tiny cubs out onto the sea ice for the very first time, to the dedicated caribou escaping wolves to save her unborn calf, join the polar parents setting out to beat the odds in a world thats changing faster than ever before.

programme.title: Hostile Planet
programme.desc: Step inside the most frigid habitat known to Earth - the poles. Here, the planets ultimate survivalists include whale-hunting polar bears, leopard-seal dodging penguins and a pack of Arctic wolves that bring down a pair of musk oxen. Polar species have evolved bodies and behaviours that help them combat the intense hostility of their habitats. But now, their world is changing so fast - literally breaking apart under their feet - and their resilience will be tested beyond the extreme.

programme.title: Kingdom of the White Wolf
programme.desc: Join Ronan Donovan, a National Geographic Explorer and photographer, as he takes the viewer on a unique adventure to track down the hard-to-find Arctic wolf. programme.title: Frozen Islands
programme.desc: It may be inhabitable for humans, but the icy ocean and frozen islands of the sub-antarctic region are home to millions of marine animals that have adapted to this testing environment. In this two-part series from National Geographic, the constant struggle for a wide variety of species is revealed, as they battle the elements and other dangers in a bid for survival. From penguins to seals, and albatrosses to whales, we showcase how these unique species live, breed and feed in the biting waters, which are also prowled by some of the most dangerous, underwater predators on our planet.

programme.title: Europes New Wild
programme.desc: This stunning six-part nature series tells the inspiring story of the rebirthing of the wild regions of the continent of Europe. A land formerly full of diverse wildlife and contrasting landscapes, Europe was in need of special rewilding teams to embark on a mission to return species to their natural habitat and this series focuses on six regions that have benefitted from the project. The Carpathian Mountains of Romania have seen the reintroduction of European bison while rural depopulation in Spain and Portugal offers up the opportunity to expand the wild nature of the Iberian Peninsula. The teams also look at how bears and humans can live peacefully, side by side and explores the myriad creatures that call the Danube Delta home. The unique culture and atmosphere of Lapland plays host to distinctive wildlife and the Sámi people and a natural balance is being restored to the Balkans.

programme.title: Wild Lapland
programme.desc: A lyrical portrayal of the enchanting, wild creatures who call Lapland home.

programme.title: Africas Hunters
programme.desc: Large carnivores such as leopards, lions and hyenas are in constant competition for their next meal for their pack in Zambias Luangwa Valley. Following the lives of the wise old leopard Kamuti who rained over the prime territory in the Luangwa Valley for 10 years, a six-week-old lion cub and a clan of spotted hyenas, this documentary series allows audiences to see these magnificent animals like never before. With up-close imagery of animals existing within Luangwa Valley and their life in the wild, feel a part of the pack with Africas Hunters.

programme.title: Trials of the Wild
programme.desc: Watch a range of wild animals trying to survive in the wilderness as they migrate, hunt and defend themselves against predators and the dangers that are living alongside them. programme.title: Africas Deadly Kingdom
programme.desc: Instead of providing in-depth examinations of the fauna of the continent of Africa, this nature series alternatively focuses on the hostile and unforgiving landscapes that the animals have to survive in. Africa is home to some of the most extreme and diverse environments on the planet, from arid deserts to lush rainforests, mountainous peaks to mighty river and lake systems, savannah grasslands to rugged coastline. This show explores these different regions and documents how the plants and creatures that inhabit them endure places where there are few resources of food and water or where competition is rife and life-threatening. The unique demands placed on these plants and animals have resulted in the development of incredibly resilient species that remain successful against all the odds.

With up-close imagery of animals existing within Luangwa Valley and their life in the wild, feel a part of the pack with Africas Hunters.

programme.title: Africas Deadly Kingdom
programme.desc: Instead of providing in-depth examinations of the fauna of the continent of Africa, this nature series alternatively focuses on the hostile and unforgiving landscapes that the animals have to survive in. Africa is home to some of the most extreme and diverse environments on the planet, from arid deserts to lush rainforests, mountainous peaks to mighty river and lake systems, savannah grasslands to rugged coastline. This show explores these different regions and documents how the plants and creatures that inhabit them endure places where there are few resources of food and water or where competition is rife and life-threatening. The unique demands placed on these plants and animals have resulted in the development of incredibly resilient species that remain successful against all the odds.
